page.title: 02HISTORY OF CHURCHILL
page.content: Churchill as a Parish dates back to early Saxon times. The original name is thought to have been Cru Wiella (Cru = hill and Wiella = a spring). The first written record of Churchill is the Domesday survey of 1086. The original Churchill was situated around the old church at the north-west corner of the present village with the medieval manor house nearby. By 1684 the village was dilapidated, and was finally abandoned after a fire which destroyed 20 houses. In 1792 the village and 6,000 acres was bought by James Haughton Langston, whose son of the same name rebuilt much of the village, higher up the hill, as well as many houses in the surrounding countryside.
